meanings.definition: The use of radio waves to transmit telephone messages.
meanings.sent1: During emergencies, radiotelephonies help people talk over long distances.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather used radiotelephonies to speak with his friends in other countries.
meanings.sent3: The spy's mission depended on successful radiotelephonies to relay secret information.
meanings.sent4: In the world of spies, radiotelephonies are like invisible messengers carrying vital messages.
meanings.sent5: The radiotelephonies crackled with static as the important call was made.

meanings.definition: The act of communicating by radio telephone.
meanings.sent1: Radiotelephonies allow sailors to stay in touch with their families while at sea.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers relied on radiotelephonies to coordinate their movements on the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game of pretend, pretending to use radiotelephonies to talk to aliens.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like a series of failed radiotelephonies, full of missed connections.
meanings.sent5: The radiotelephonies buzzed with excitement as the news of the victory was shared.
